body.p: Install uisdk-build using npm from provided URL:

Open your bash/cmd (in any location): npm install -g <tarball url>
... uisdk-build will be installed globally and available from any location on this machine. This command can also be used by providing path to local file instead URL (if you choose to download uisdk-build package from a direct link).
body.h2: Installation from provided NPM registry (Global - NPM install)
body.p: Install uisdk-build from a npm compatible registry that contains uisdk-build package:

Open your bash/cmd (in any location): npm --registry http://myRegistry/ install -g uisdk-build
... uisdk-build will be installed globally and available from any location on this machine.

While in project root: npm --registry http://myRegistry/ install uisdk-build
... installation will create "node_modules" folder in project root.
Advanced users may choose to install UISDK-buidl this way. In this case master script will be located at: project_root/node_modules/uisdk-build/src/build.js

You can download UISDK-Build in npm package format from below location:
UISDK-Build v0.0.6 (from Nexus)

All dependencies are bundled together with UISDK-build therefore developer does not need to worry about them. However in order to run machine needs to have installed:
Node.js installed and present in global path
NPM installed (ussualy bundled with Node.js)
